page.title: 20CHANGE IN MARTLESHAM VILLAGE
page.content: We talked to a lady who had lived in Martlesham for 30 years and from her we've learnt how the village has changed in that time. The village has grown a lot. The main road or A12 was much narrower than it is now and Bealings Road, School Lane and the Felixstowe Road were the only other roads. The Blacktiles Estate and Redwold Close were built in the 1950's and 1960's and since then Viking Heights and Angela Close. The water main only reached the Police House - houses to the east along the A12 {drew water from wells}. The only shop was the Post Office, near the Red Lion, which sold food. There was a {forge} which has now closed. St Mary's Church has not been altered, but the number of Sunday services are fewer now.
